alert.note: Alert for Buncombe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 8:23PM EST until January 11 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Asheville affecting Buncombe County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...French Broad River at Asheville. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Action stage flooding continues. French Broad River floodwaters continue to flood Woodfin Riverside Park, the floodplain adjacent to Craggy Dam Reservoir, Carrier Park, and French Broad River Park as well as other low-lying areas within the flood plain. Floodwaters may be approaching Amboy Rd. and Lyman St. Local small tributaries including Smith Mill Creek near Emma Rd. may be exceeding bankfull levels. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 2.4 feet Monday morning. - Action/Advisory Stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued byThursday morning at 1100 AM EST.
